title: New Bilgewater Stories
body:
[Pyke](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_GB/story/champion/pyke/) | [Then, Teeth](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/pyke-color-story)
[Nautilius](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/champion/nautilus/)
[Fizz](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/champion/fizz/)
[Tahm Kench](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/champion/tahmkench/)
[New Picture's for MF's Color Story as well](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/missfortune-color-story/)

Bonus: 6 Audio Tales as well
[Tall Tales of the Deep Sea](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1wj21zLtgAA)
[Nautilus & The Ophidian](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aSNzccB5hbc)
[Fizz & The Lucky Kraken](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fwOHxTMyew4)
[Tahm Kench & The Gambler’s Woe](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u00fZC1Z5Rc)
[Pyke, the Drowned Man ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eFRwP9lsLEo)
[Never Turn Your Back on the Sea](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O4is-IBs-MI)

replies.body:
Oh thank fuck, I can finally stop being one of the only people who keeps complaining that such an amazing character like Tahm Kench had no lore outside of a teaser trailer! 

'Bout time Narrative.
You mean like... if we took notice of what people said? WHAT HERESY IS THIS? :-P

Honestly its been too long since the silver tounge catfish was released that seeing written lore really caught me off guard this morning. Choked up a bit even. Although it makes obvious sence that TK would be relevant in this LU. 

This has renforced my belief.

Weirdly, his half-finished long bio was sat in the file of "stuff we could get around to and release eventually" that I inherited when I got here. I was like, we can do better than just finishing it...
Woah.  That Fizz story took a turn for the terrifying.  He really _is_ a malign terror.  Wow.

Yeah. I like how they show that when dealing with tricksters it's not all fun and games, as that constant pranking and such would lead one closer and closer to madness. That coin at the end really sealed the deal on Fizz being an entity that gets kicks from watching people live in terror.
That’s not just madness.  That’s sadism.  Fizz is officially a bad guy.
Do you think he understands the horrors he's committing? Do you think he sees what he's doing as harmless? Does he realize the psychological scars he inflicts on people?

I think his new Universe quote sums him up perfectly: “You people can’t even breathe water. You’re boring.”

I genuinely don't think he means to cause harm... but he also doesn't quite understand humans, or how they work.

I know I'm replying hours later, but I'd like to say I like this sort of character. The one that's so alien it doesn't even realize it's causing harm. It's far more interesting than just a jerk or someone who likes to see people suffer.

Is Lars’ depiction of him even true? You’ve made it a point to say narrators aren’t reliable, and he seemed to have a connection to Pyke. Even the video description emphasized pulling fact from fiction.

> [{quoted}](name=midnight oil24,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pi41l84p,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2018-06-01T00:41:45.006+0000)
>
> Yeah. I like how they show that when dealing with tricksters it's not all fun and games, as that constant pranking and such would lead one closer and closer to madness. That coin at the end really sealed the deal on Fizz being an entity that gets kicks from watching people live in terror.

I disagree. I took it as Fizz was trying to compensate the man for the fun time but because of his trickster nature the man took it to be the coin that cost him his ship. It emphasises that your legacy precedes you more than your reality. I don't think Fizz was ever doing anything wrong.

That's definitely a possibility, though I think that just because Fizz didn't see what he was doing as wrong doesn't mean it wasn't wrong since it was still psychologically scarring Lars. Someone from another culture that has much more lenient laws towards harming people (just making something up here) wouldn't get a free pass on their assault just because they're from another culture.

Although most people aren't usually ancient aquatic beings.

> [{quoted}](name=midnight oil24,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pi41l84p,comment-id=0003000000010000,timestamp=2018-06-01T12:25:32.200+0000)
>
> That's definitely a possibility, though I think that just because Fizz didn't see what he was doing as wrong doesn't mean it wasn't wrong since it was still psychologically scarring Lars. Someone from another culture that has much more lenient laws towards harming people (just making something up here) wouldn't get a free pass on their assault just because they're from another culture.
> 
> Although most people aren't usually ancient aquatic beings.

*Looks at Noxus* I don't know.... 

It's definitely a case of clashing cultures. If the question is "Is fizz Malicious?" the answer is no. If the question is "Does fizz cause harm?" then yes. But that's just the nature of a good trickster.
nautilus's short story is actually quite good.
I really like the voice acting in the audio tales. If only they were animated though...
